member.name: IPartsList.GetCount
member.summary: The GetCount method gets the number of parts in the parts list.
member.param: Pointer to a UINT variable into which the method writes the parts count (the number of parts in the parts list).

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

member.name: IPartsList.GetPart
member.summary: The GetPart method gets a part from the parts list.
member.param: The part number of the part to retrieve. If the parts list contains n parts, the parts are numbered 0 to n– 1. Call the method to get the number of parts in the list.

Pointer to a pointer variable into which the method writes the address of the interface of the part object. Through this method, the caller obtains a counted reference to the IPart interface. The caller is responsible for releasing the interface, when it is no longer needed, by calling the interface's Release method. If the GetPart call fails, *ppPart is NULL.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

listheader.description: Parameter nIndex is out of range.

summary.para: The IPartsList interface represents a list of parts, each of which is an object with an interface that represents a connector or subunit. A client obtains a reference to an IPartsList interface by calling the , , or method.
For a code example that uses the IPartsList interface, see the implementation of the SelectCaptureDevice function in Device Topologies.
